reviews.text: Magnificent terrace view, friendly staff, excellent food. Many wonderful spots - terraces, fountains, pool. Wonderful design, reasonable price. close to the city - fifteen minutes walk through very nice area.
reviews.title: Great view, excellent standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this small hotel is its balconies, which come with every room and look out to the Toledo skyline. Our room looked out to the Alcazar and the cathedral, both lit up in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great balcony views, reasonable price, good location if you dont mind walking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms aren't large, but it's a good size for 2 people. Floors are tiled, double bed was 2 twins pushed together. Our bathroom was spacious, shower was great, and everything was clean. The breakfast featured fresh orange juice and decent choice of cold items. Lobby and breakfast room were tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Great pool and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was very patchy - one young lady was very sullen while others were more friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two possible areas of concern: noise, and distance from the city. I expected the latter because how else do you get a view? It cost 7euros to cab it there from the train station. We are both walkers so relished the 10-15 min walk into town and back everyday (esp after a big dinner!) The road back to the hotel is slightly uphill but just a little. Toledo seems fairly safe, so wear walking shoes and you'll be fine even if walking at midnight.
reviews.title: A great hotel with stunning views over Toledo

likes.liked: — The size and cleanliness of the room and bathroom
likes.disliked: — Restaurant and bar not open on Sundays

reviews.text: Nice room with a terrace facing Toledo Old Town. Beautiful sunset from there.
reviews.title: Great view of Toledo Old Town - good value

reviews.text: There is a pool, restaurant and a very friendly staff. 10 minute walk to the old town.
reviews.title: Wonderful view, good location (if you appreciate a brisk 20-30 minute walk), excellent breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Fabulous view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this choice for our one day stopover en route from Madrid to Granada. The highlight for us was the private terrace offering a marvelous (if a bit distant) view of old Toledo (see photos). Each room has its own terrace with the Toledo view. The room itself was average size (not tiny), with a comfortable bed and modern bathroom (shower only, no bath). The small pool was very refreshing following the mostly uphill walk back from old Toledo. The hotel also has 2 or 3 large terraces with tables and chairs, but we’re not sure if they have service. (So you can save money by bringing your own snacks and drinks?) There is small bar in the (nice) lounge, but again we’re not sure about the service – we didn’t see any. The breakfast was plenty for us, although not the huge selection you may find at fancier hotels.
reviews.title: Great views over the city.
